jgame

Class GSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • jgame.GObject
      • jgame.GSprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, GAnimatable, GObjectHolder, GPaintable

    public class GSprite
extends GObject
implements GAnimatable, java.awt.image.ImageObserver
    An object whose display and bounding box are determined by an image, or multiple images for an animation.
    Author:
    William Chargin

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  GSprite.Primitive
      A primitive representation for a sprite.
      static class  GSprite.PrimitiveShape
      A collection of basic primitive shapes.
      class  GSprite.ShapePrimitive
      A primitive object based on a Java Shape.

    • Field Detail

      • nineSliceCenter

        private java.awt.Rectangle nineSliceCenter
        The center rectangle for nine-slice scaling.

      • images

        private final java.util.List<java.awt.Image> images
        The list of images that make up this sprite. This may contain one image (for a still sprite), more than one image (for an animated sprite), or no images at all (in which case the sprite will not be drawn and no error will be thrown).

      • primitive

        private GSprite.Primitive primitive
        The primitive shape used for this object's bounding shape calculations. Default is GSprite.PrimitiveShape.RECTANGLE.

      • frame

        private int frame
        The current frame index.

      • playing

        private boolean playing
        Whether or not the animation is currently playing.

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Description copied from interface: GAnimatable
        Determines whether or not the animation is currently playing. The default value is true.
        Specified by:
        isPlaying in interface GAnimatable
        Returns:
        true if the animation is playing, or false if it is not

      • nextFrame

        public void nextFrame()
        Description copied from interface: GAnimatable
        Advances this object to the next frame.

        If the animation is already on the last frame, it will loop from the first frame.

        If the animation contains no frames, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        If the animation is not playing, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        nextFrame in interface GAnimatable

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Description copied from class: GObject
        Paints this object. The default GObject implementation does nothing but paint subcomponents.
        Specified by:
        paint in interface GPaintable
        Overrides:
        paint in class GObject
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context on which to paint

      • paintNineSlice

        private void paintNineSlice(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                            java.awt.Image i)
        Paints nine-slice scaling for the given image onto the given graphics context.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context on which to paint
        i - the image to paint

      • preparePaint

        public void preparePaint(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Description copied from interface: GPaintable
        Prepares the canvas for painting by performing any necessary modifications to the graphics context.
        Specified by:
        preparePaint in interface GPaintable
        Overrides:
        preparePaint in class GObject
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context to prepare

      • previousFrame

        public void previousFrame()
        Description copied from interface: GAnimatable
        Takes this object to the previous frame.

        If the animation is already on the first frame, it will loop from the last frame.

        If the animation contains no frames, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        If the animation is not playing, no action will be taken and no error will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        previousFrame in interface GAnimatable

      • setFrameNumber

        public void setFrameNumber(int frameNumber)
                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Description copied from interface: GAnimatable
        Takes this object to the specified frame number.
        Specified by:
        setFrameNumber in interface GAnimatable
        Parameters:
        frameNumber - the new frame number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the frame number is out of bounds for this animation

      • setImage

        public void setImage(java.awt.Image image)
        Sets this sprite's image to the given image. All other image(s), if any, will be removed from the list. The sprite will be resized to the size of the image. The frame number will also be set to 0.

        All other constructors cascade to this constructor.

        Parameters:
        image - the new image

      • setImages

        public void setImages(java.awt.Image... sequence)
        This method delegates capabilities to setImages(List) using Arrays.asList(Object...).

        This method is equivalent to setImages(List) except that it accepts an array instead of a collection.

        Parameters:
        sequence - the new image sequence
        See Also:
        setImages(List)

      • setImages

        public void setImages(java.util.List<java.awt.Image> sequence)
        Sets this sprite's image sequence to the given list of images. All other image(s), if any, will be removed from the list. The sprite will be resized to the size of the first image, if the list of images is non-empty. The frame number will also be set to 0.

        This method is equivalent to setImages(Image[]) except that it accepts a collection instead of an array.

        Parameters:
        sequence - the new image sequence

      • setNineSliceCenter

        public void setNineSliceCenter(java.awt.Rectangle nineSliceCenter)
        Sets the center rectangle for nine-slice scaling.
        Parameters:
        nineSliceCenter - the new center, or null to disable nine-slice scaling

      • setPlaying

        public void setPlaying(boolean playing)
        Description copied from interface: GAnimatable
        Sets whether or not the animation is currently playing. The default value is true.
        Specified by:
        setPlaying in interface GAnimatable
        Parameters:
        playing - true if the animation should play, or false if it should not

      • setPrimitive

        public void setPrimitive(GSprite.Primitive primitive)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the primitive shape used for this sprite's bounding shape calculations.
        Parameters:
        primitive - the primitive object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if primitive is null
